org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.task.client

Class DataSpaceNodeClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.task.client.DataSpaceNodeClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, RemoteSpace

    @PublicAPI
public class DataSpaceNodeClient
extends Object
implements RemoteSpace, Serializable
    DataSpace api available as a variable during the execution of a task. it is based on the RemoteSpace interface.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect()
      Connects to the dataspace at the default schedulerRestUrl, using the current user credentials

      Connects to the server at the specified schedulerRestUrl, using the current user credentials
      void deleteFile(String remotePath)
      Delete the given file or folder(including its content) inside the remote space
      void deleteFiles(String remotePath, String pattern)
      Delete the remote files described by the given pattern The following special characters can be used inside the pattern :
      ** matches zero or more directories
      * matches zero or more characters
      ? matches one character

      Disconnect from the server

      Returns the connection info, if initialized previously

      * matches zero or more characters
      ? matches one character

      ? matches one character

        public void connect()
             throws Exception

        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs during the connection.

      • connect

        public void connect(String url)
             throws Exception
        Connects to the server at the specified schedulerRestUrl, using the current user credentials
        Parameters:
        url - schedulerRestUrl of the scheduler
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs during the connection

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
                throws NotConnectedException,
                       PermissionException
        Disconnect from the server
        Throws:
        NotConnectedException - if the current session is not connected
        PermissionException - in case of permission issue

        Parameters:
        sid - session identifier

        Returns:

      • listFiles

        public List<String> listFiles(String remotePath,
                              String pattern)
                       throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: RemoteSpace
        List the content of the given remote directory, using a glob pattern

        The following special characters can be used inside the pattern :
        ** matches zero or more directories
        * matches zero or more characters
        ? matches one character

        Specified by:
        listFiles in interface RemoteSpace
        Parameters:
        remotePath - path in the RemoteSpace where files should be listed. Use "." for remote root path.
        pattern - pattern to locate files
        Returns:
        a list of remote paths matching the pattern
        Throws:
        FileSystemException
        See Also:
        "https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/nio/file/FileSystem.html#getPathMatcher(java.lang.String)"

      • pushFile

        public void pushFile(File localPath,
                     String remotePath)
              throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: RemoteSpace
        Push the given file or directory(including its content) from the local space to the remote space. When pushing a file or directory, the remotePath must contain the target new file or directory
        Specified by:
        pushFile in interface RemoteSpace
        Parameters:
        localPath - path to the local file or directory
        remotePath - path in the RemoteSpace where to put the file or folder. Use "." for remote root path.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException

      • pushFiles

        public void pushFiles(File localDirectory,
                      String pattern,
                      String remotePath)
               throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: RemoteSpace
        Push the local files described by the given pattern to the remote space The following special characters can be used inside the pattern :
        ** matches zero or more directories
        * matches zero or more characters
        ? matches one character
        Specified by:
        pushFiles in interface RemoteSpace
        Parameters:
        localDirectory - local directory used as base
        pattern - pattern to locate files inside the localDirectory
        remotePath - path in the RemoteSpace where to put the files. Use "." for remote root path.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException
        See Also:
        "https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/nio/file/FileSystem.html#getPathMatcher(java.lang.String)"

      • pullFile

        public File pullFile(String remotePath,
                     File localPath)
              throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: RemoteSpace
        Pull the given file or folder(including its content) from the remote space to the local space
        Specified by:
        pullFile in interface RemoteSpace
        Parameters:
        remotePath - path to the remote file (relative to the RemoteSpace root)
        localPath - path in the local file system where to put the file or folder
        Returns:
        the path to the file or directory pulled
        Throws:
        FileSystemException

      • pullFiles

        public Set<File> pullFiles(String remotePath,
                           String pattern,
                           File localPath)
                    throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: RemoteSpace
        Pull the remote files described by the given pattern to the local space The following special characters can be used inside the pattern :
        ** matches zero or more directories
        * matches zero or more characters
        ? matches one character
        Specified by:
        pullFiles in interface RemoteSpace
        Parameters:
        remotePath - path in the RemoteSpace used as base for the pattern (e.g. "/")
        pattern - pattern to locate files inside the RemoteSpace
        localPath - path in the local file system where to put the files
        Returns:
        a set of files pulled
        Throws:
        FileSystemException
        See Also:
        "https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/nio/file/FileSystem.html#getPathMatcher(java.lang.String)"
